docs.lead_paragraph: LEAD: Just deserts are on the menu at Joe Pintauro's ''Moving Targets.'' In this amiable anthology of nine brief sketches (at the Vineyard Theater), fathers and sons, friends and lovers come to terms with strained relationships - and couples try to remember what drew them together in the first place.

docs.snippet: LEAD: There is only one movie house in the Sicilian town of Bagheria, outside Palermo. Giuseppe Tornatore, who at the age of 33 does not exactly go back very far, can remember when, as recently as the mid-1960's, his hometown managed to sustain ei...
docs.lead_paragraph: LEAD: There is only one movie house in the Sicilian town of Bagheria, outside Palermo. Giuseppe Tornatore, who at the age of 33 does not exactly go back very far, can remember when, as recently as the mid-1960's, his hometown managed to sustain eight theaters with a population half its present size.

docs.lead_paragraph: LEAD: ''That's not me; I don't look like that at all,'' laughs Dame Judi Dench, as she recalls her begrimed, ruddy Mistress Quickly in the Kenneth Branagh film of ''Henry V,'' which has won acclaim in Britain and the United States. docs.lead_paragraph: LEAD: In the early 1980's, Paul Brickman made his directorial debut with a buoyant film about a clean-cut Chicago teen-ager who turns over his parents' pristine home to a bevy of call girls. Called ''Risky Business,'' the kinetic comedy ended up a box-office hit.

docs.snippet: LEAD: Anna Arnold Hedgeman, an educator, civil rights advocate and the first black woman to be a member of a mayoral cabinet in New York City, died Jan. 17 in Harlem Hospital. She was 90 years old and had lived in Harlem for many years....
